problem_text: If L K = 4, M P = 3, P Q = 6, K J = 2, R S = 6, and L P = 2, find J H.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: L on KM, KQ, L on JM, K on JL, 2 = LP, 2 = JK, 6 = RS, 6 = PQ, 4 = KL, KM, MQ, 3 = MP, ∠HMP, Q on MR, J on HM, HS || JR, JR || LP, R on MS, ∠PMH, JR || KQ, L on HM, ∠HMQ, ∠RMH, KQ || LP, K on HM, ∠QMH, P on MQ

Step 2:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : L on KM
Conclusions: KM = KL + LM

Step 3:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : L on JM
Conclusions: JM = JL + LM

Step 4:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : K on JL
Conclusions: JL = JK + KL

Step 5:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 2 = JK, 4 = KL
Conclusions: 6 = JK + KL

Step 6:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : KQ, KM, MQ
Conclusions: △KMQ

Step 7:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 6 = PQ, 3 = MP
Conclusions: 9 = MP + PQ

Step 8:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : J on HM
Conclusions: HM = HJ + JM

Step 9:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : HS || JR
Conclusions: ∠MHS = ∠MJR, ∠MRJ = ∠MSH

Step 10:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : JR || LP
Conclusions: ∠MPL = ∠MRJ

Step 11:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : R on MS
Conclusions: MS = MR + RS

Step 12:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : JR || KQ
Conclusions: ∠MQK = ∠MRJ, ∠MJR = ∠MKQ

Step 13:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠PMH, L on HM
Conclusions: ∠PMH = ∠PML

Step 14:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠HMP, L on HM
Conclusions: ∠HMP = ∠LMP

Step 15:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : L on HM, ∠HMQ
Conclusions: ∠HMQ = ∠LMQ

Step 16:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : Q on MR, ∠RMH
Conclusions: ∠QMH = ∠RMH

Step 17:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : J on HM, ∠RMH
Conclusions: ∠RMH = ∠RMJ

Step 18:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : KQ || LP
Conclusions: ∠MPL = ∠MQK, ∠MKQ = ∠MLP

Step 19:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : K on HM, ∠HMQ
Conclusions: ∠HMQ = ∠KMQ

Step 20:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : P on MQ, ∠HMQ
Conclusions: ∠HMP = ∠HMQ

Step 21:
Theorem: Line Segment Split
Premises : P on MQ
Conclusions: MQ = MP + PQ

Step 22:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : P on MQ, ∠QMH
Conclusions: ∠PMH = ∠QMH

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : JL = JK + KL, 6 = JK + KL
Conclusions: 6 = JL

Step 24:
Theorem: Perimeter Definition
Premises : △KMQ
Conclusions: Perimeter(△KMQ) = KM + KQ + MQ

Step 25:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠MHS = ∠MJR, ∠MRJ = ∠MSH
Conclusions: △HMS ~ △JMR

Step 26:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠MQK = ∠MRJ, ∠MJR = ∠MKQ
Conclusions: △JMR ~ △KMQ

Step 27:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠MKQ = ∠MLP, ∠MJR = ∠MKQ
Conclusions: ∠MJR = ∠MLP

Step 28:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠HMQ = ∠LMQ, ∠HMQ = ∠KMQ
Conclusions: ∠KMQ = ∠LMQ

Step 29:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠HMQ = ∠LMQ, ∠HMP = ∠LMP, ∠HMP = ∠HMQ
Conclusions: ∠LMP = ∠LMQ

Step 30:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 9 = MP + PQ, MQ = MP + PQ
Conclusions: 9 = MQ

Step 31:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠PMH = ∠QMH, ∠PMH = ∠PML
Conclusions: ∠PML = ∠QMH

Step 32:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △HMS ~ △JMR
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_j_m_r = HM / JM, ∠MRJ = ∠MSH, sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_j_m_r = MS / MR

Step 33:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △JMR ~ △KMQ
Conclusions: MR / MQ = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△KMQ), JM / KM = MR / MQ, ∠MQK = ∠MRJ

Step 34:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠KMQ = ∠LMQ, ∠LMP = ∠LMQ
Conclusions: ∠KMQ = ∠LMP

Step 35:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠PML = ∠QMH, ∠QMH = ∠RMH
Conclusions: ∠PML = ∠RMH

Step 36:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 9 = MQ, MR / MQ = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△KMQ)
Conclusions: MR / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△KMQ)

Step 37:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 9 = MQ, JM / KM = MR / MQ
Conclusions: MR / 9 = JM / KM

Step 38:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠KMQ = ∠LMP, ∠MPL = ∠MQK, ∠MKQ = ∠MLP
Conclusions: △KMQ ~ △LMP

Step 39:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠RMH = ∠RMJ, ∠PML = ∠RMH
Conclusions: ∠PML = ∠RMJ

Step 40:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △KMQ ~ △LMP
Conclusions: ∠MKQ = ∠MLP, sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = KQ / LP, KM / LM = MQ / MP, ∠KMQ = ∠LMP, sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = MQ / MP

Step 41:
Theorem: Angle-Angle Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠MPL = ∠MRJ, ∠MJR = ∠MLP, ∠PML = ∠RMJ
Conclusions: △JMR ~ △LMP

Step 42:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 2 = LP, sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = KQ / LP
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = KQ / 2

Step 43:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 9 = MQ, KM / LM = MQ / MP, 3 = MP
Conclusions: 9 / 3 = KM / LM

Step 44:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 9 = MQ, sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = MQ / MP, 3 = MP
Conclusions: 9 / 3 = sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p

Step 45:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △JMR ~ △LMP
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = MR / MP, JR / LP = MR / MP, sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = JR / LP, ∠PML = ∠RMJ, ∠MJR = ∠MLP

Step 46:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : KM = KL + LM, 4 = KL, 9 / 3 = KM / LM
Conclusions: 6 = KM

Step 47:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : JM = JL + LM, 6 = JL, 4 = KL, 9 / 3 = KM / LM, KM = KL + LM
Conclusions: 8 = JM

Step 48:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p = KQ / 2, 9 / 3 = sim_ratio_triangle_k_m_q_triangle_l_m_p
Conclusions: 9 / 3 = KQ / 2

Step 49:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = MR / MP, 3 = MP
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = MR / 3

Step 50:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 2 = LP, 3 = MP, JR / LP = MR / MP
Conclusions: JR / 2 = MR / 3

Step 51:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = JR / LP, 2 = LP
Conclusions: sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = JR / 2

Step 52:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 4 = KL, 9 / 3 = KM / LM, Perimeter(△KMQ) = KM + KQ + MQ, 9 = MQ, 9 / 3 = KQ / 2, KM = KL + LM
Conclusions: 21 = Perimeter(△KMQ)

Step 53:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = MR / 3
Conclusions: 3 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = MR

Step 54:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = JR / 2
Conclusions: 2 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = JR

Step 55:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 21 = Perimeter(△KMQ), MR / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / Perimeter(△KMQ), 3 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = MR
Conclusions: (3 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p) / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21

Step 56:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = MR, 6 = KM, MR / 9 = JM / KM, 8 = JM
Conclusions: 8 / 6 = (3 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p) / 9

Step 57:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : (3 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p) / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21, 8 / 6 = (3 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p) / 9
Conclusions: 8 / 6 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21

Step 58:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = MR, (3 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p) / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21, 8 / 6 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21
Conclusions: 12 = MR

Step 59:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 8 / 6 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21, 6 = RS, (3 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p) / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21, 3 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = MR, MS = MR + RS
Conclusions: 18 = MS

Step 60:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : (3 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p) / 9 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21, 8 / 6 = Perimeter(△JMR) / 21, 2 * sim_ratio_triangle_j_m_r_triangle_l_m_p = JR
Conclusions: 8 = JR

Step 61:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 18 = MS, 12 = MR
Conclusions: 1.5 = MS / MR

Step 62:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 8 = JM, 8 = JR
Conclusions: JM = JR

Step 63:
Theorem: Evaluate
Premises : 12 = MR, 8 = JM, 8 = JR
Conclusions: 14 = (JM + JR + MR) / 2

Step 64:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 1.5 = MS / MR, sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_j_m_r = MS / MR
Conclusions: 1.5 = sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_j_m_r

Step 65:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_j_m_r = HM / JM, 1.5 = sim_ratio_triangle_h_m_s_triangle_j_m_r
Conclusions: 1.5 = HM / JM

Step 66:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 14 = (JM + JR + MR) / 2, JM = JR, 1.5 = HM / JM, JR / 2 = MR / 3, HM = HJ + JM
Conclusions: 4 = HJ
